messages.message:
:wave:
I'd say check in with IT, since RelEng / SRE doesn't manage the github repos.
Thanks @Cody Boggs! IT actually referred to me to engineering, saying someone over there manages the `instabase` repo?

Oh, that's... interesting. :upside_down_face:
I mean I have sufficient rights to the repo for some reason, yes, but I don't know anything about credentials stored therein nor how any of the non-standard cross-repo stuff works :grimacing:
Is there any way to tell who the `instabase` repo admins are? Maybe there’s someone in engineering who deals with that repo’s security?
Wondering if they were thinking of @Heymian who isn't quite back yet :thinking_face:
I'll see if I can track down any relevant-looking creds in the repo. Just be aware I might be useless here :upside_down_face:
Thanks for any help! I’ll keep my expectations low.
Chris, I can tell you who has admin in that repo, in referring you to eng my point was IT hadn't made any changes.

Yea I just found the relevant page in the IB repo but it doesn't have that secret - it'd be in the other repo's actions config, and I don't have access to that one :slightly_smiling_face:

Thanks @derrick.smith
Two teams have admin in that repo. Releng (https://github.com/orgs/instabase/teams/releng) and Eng-admins (https://github.com/orgs/instabase/teams/eng-admins)
Who set that action up in the first place? It's also possible that it was a PAT and it's now disabled because they're no longer here?

Thanks @derrick.smith.
I set up the GH Action in the `instabase-docs` repo, but I must have had someone else add the `INSTABASE_REPO_RO_TOKEN` secret to `instabase-docs`, since I wouldn’t have known what value to store there.

I’m not sure how to find out if we need to replace that secret’s value with a new token?

Well my guess based on the error is that token is no longer valid which is why I suggested rotating it. I don't see any obvious service account used for that in the repo so it was probably some sort of personal token.
If you don't remember who helped you set that up it would be hard to rule out whether it was from them being deactivated.
Sounds very plausible! Do you know who could generate a new RO access token for `instabase` that we could set the `instabase-docs` secret to?
I can help with that, probably good to steer it back to the ticket so I can document the approval for that.
Great, thank you. And sorry for the detour, @Cody Boggs.
No worries, thanks all for digging in :+1:
